revised_title: Operational Temperature Sounding of the Stratosphere: The Middle Atmosphere Observed from Balloons, Rockets, and Satellites
tldr: This article discusses the development and use of the stratospheric sounding unit (SSU) on Tiros N series of operational meteorological satellites to measure atmospheric temperature for generating routine analyses for the stratosphere. The SSU is a 3-channel infrared radiometer that uses the selective chopping technique to achieve sharp weighting functions within the stratosphere. The retrieved data is used to monitor the in-flight performance of the instrument and to provide stratospheric temperature analyses.
